meanings.definition: To steer or guide incorrectly or wrongly.
meanings.sent1: He missteered the boat and ended up in the wrong bay.
meanings.sent2: The driver missteered the car and almost hit the curb.
meanings.sent3: She missteered the shopping cart into the cereal aisle by accident.
meanings.sent4: The detective missteered the investigation, focusing on the wrong suspect.
meanings.sent5: The pilot missteered the plane, causing it to veer off course.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake in steering or guiding.
meanings.sent1: The hiker missteered off the trail and got lost in the woods.
meanings.sent2: The captain missteered the ship, leading it into dangerous waters.
meanings.sent3: The robot missteered and bumped into the wall, startling everyone.
meanings.sent4: The teacher missteered the class discussion, focusing on the wrong topic.
meanings.sent5: The child missteered the toy car, sending it crashing into the furniture.
